meanings.definition: Located on the outside of a boat's hull.
meanings.sent1: The outboard engine was securely fastened to the boat's side.
meanings.sent2: The outboard lights illuminated the water around the vessel.
meanings.sent3: The outboard chairs on the deck provided a perfect spot for relaxing in the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her outboard jewelry sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The outboard decorations on the boat made it stand out from the rest in the marina.

meanings.definition: A motor attached to the outside of a boat.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman started the outboard to head out to sea for the day.
meanings.sent2: The outboard hummed softly as the boat glided through the calm waters.
meanings.sent3: The outboard seemed to have a mind of its own, revving up unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The outboard roared to life, propelling the boat forward with great speed.
meanings.sent5: The outboard's reliability made it the captain's favorite piece of equipment on board.

meanings.definition: Away from the center of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The crew members scattered outboard as the storm approached.
meanings.sent2: The sailors moved outboard to balance the weight distribution on the vessel.
meanings.sent3: The captain jokingly told the crew to dance outboard to keep the ship steady.
meanings.sent4: The passengers leaned outboard to catch a glimpse of the dolphins swimming alongside.
meanings.sent5: The seagulls flew outboard, following the ship in search of scraps of food.
